topic.title: Before you start
topic.shortdesc: Be ready to start working on DITA documentation.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Be ready to start working on DITA documentation.

topic.title: Clone the documentation project from Gitlab

topicmeta.navtitle: Clone the documentation project from Gitlab
topicmeta.linktext: Clone the documentation project from Gitlab

topic.title: Configure oXygen
topic.shortdesc: Install and configure oXygen XML Editor to be able to build PDF and HTML output of the documentation.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Install and configure oXygen XML Editor to be able to build PDF and HTML output of the documentation.

topic.title: Writing guidelines
topic.shortdesc: Make sure that you follow the writing guidelines to ensure consistency in the writing of the documentation.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Make sure that you follow the writing guidelines to ensure consistency in the writing of the documentation.

topic.title: Insert reusable content into topics
topic.shortdesc: Once you have created the topics gathering all the terms, steps or any type of reusable content, you need to add these topics as "keydef" in the header of the ditamaps.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Once you have created the topics gathering all the terms, steps or any type of reusable content, you need to add these topics as "keydef" in the header of the ditamaps.

topic.title: Update part numbers for each revision of a PDF document
topic.shortdesc: Each PDF document provided as part of the PAX CHECKPOINT Screening Software is assigned a part number. The part numbers are stored in the part_numbers.dita topic under pax-solutions\src\EN.

topicmeta.navtitle: Update part numbers for each revision of a PDF document
topicmeta.linktext: Update part numbers for each revision of a PDF document
topicmeta.shortdesc: Each PDF document provided as part of the PAX CHECKPOINT Screening Software is assigned a part number. The part numbers are stored in the part_numbers.dita topic under pax-solutions\src\EN.

topic.title: Update the part number to be displayed in the PDF file

topicmeta.navtitle: Update the part number to be displayed in the PDF file
topicmeta.linktext: Update the part number to be displayed in the PDF file

topic.title: Include the reference to the part_numbers.dita topic in the DITA Map file

topicmeta.navtitle: Include the reference to the part_numbers.dita topic in the DITA Map file
topicmeta.linktext: Include the reference to the part_numbers.dita topic in the DITA Map file

topic.title: Insert the part number to the DITA Map file

topicmeta.navtitle: Insert the part number to the DITA Map file
topicmeta.linktext: Insert the part number to the DITA Map file

topic.title: Write topics
topic.shortdesc: Start building your documents by creating topics.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Start building your documents by creating topics.

topic.title: Create a DITA map
topic.shortdesc: DITA maps are maps that organize DITA topics into structured collections of information.

topicmeta.shortdesc: DITA maps are maps that organize DITA topics into structured collections of information.

topic.title: Add a title to the DITA map
topic.shortdesc: The title of the DITA map will reflect the title of the PDF output file.

topicmeta.navtitle: Add a title to the DITA map
topicmeta.linktext: Add a title to the DITA map
topicmeta.shortdesc: The title of the DITA map will reflect the title of the PDF output file.

topic.title: Add topics to the DITA map
topic.shortdesc: In your bookmap, you will now add chapters and topics.

topicmeta.navtitle: Add topics to the DITA map
topicmeta.linktext: Add topics to the DITA map
topicmeta.shortdesc: In your bookmap, you will now add chapters and topics.

topic.title: Create glossary topics
topic.shortdesc: Add entries to your glossary by adding Glossentry topics.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Add entries to your glossary by adding Glossentry topics.

topic.title: Add conditions to the content
topic.shortdesc: With DITA, you can add conditional text to topics or parts of topics to include or exclude them from the output and create documents that are customized for one particular customer or one particular version of the product.

topicmeta.shortdesc: With DITA, you can add conditional text to topics or parts of topics to include or exclude them from the output and create documents that are customized for one particular customer or one particular version of the product.

topic.title: Add conditional text to parts of topics

topicmeta.navtitle: Add conditional text to parts of topics
topicmeta.linktext: Add conditional text to parts of topics

topic.title: Insert conditions in the transformation
topic.shortdesc: Once you have created a Profiling Attribute and a Profiling Condition Set, you can apply the filter before generating the output.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Once you have created a Profiling Attribute and a Profiling Condition Set, you can apply the filter before generating the output.

topic.title: Generate PDF and Webhelp outputs
topic.shortdesc: Follow the instructions to create a PDF file or HTML files from DITA topics.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Follow the instructions to create a PDF file or HTML files from DITA topics.

topic.title: Generate a PDF from a ditamap file
topic.shortdesc: This procedure explains how to generate a PDF from dita topics with oXygen XML Editor.

topicmeta.navtitle: Generate a PDF from a ditamap file
topicmeta.linktext: Generate a PDF from a ditamap file
topicmeta.shortdesc: This procedure explains how to generate a PDF from dita topics with oXygen XML Editor.

topic.title: Generate a webhelp from a ditamap file
topic.shortdesc: The following procedure provides instructions on how to generate the HTML webhelp to be integrated to the Vanderlande Portal.

topicmeta.linktext: Generate a webhelp from a ditamap file
topicmeta.shortdesc: The following procedure provides instructions on how to generate the HTML webhelp to be integrated to the Vanderlande Portal.

topic.title: Generate a PDF from a markdown file
topic.shortdesc: This procedure explains how to generate a PDF with the Vanderlande look and feel from a markdown file. This procedure applies to the generation of the PDF version of the PAX CHECKPOINT Screening Software migration procedure.

topicmeta.shortdesc: This procedure explains how to generate a PDF with the Vanderlande look and feel from a markdown file. This procedure applies to the generation of the PDF version of the PAX CHECKPOINT Screening Software migration procedure.

topic.shortdesc: Deliver the resulting PDF and HTML outputs to the proper locations.

topic.title: Deliver PDF files to PAX Delivery Sharepoint
topic.shortdesc: This procedure describes how to deliver the PAX CHECKPOINT Screening Software documentation other than Relase Notes to the PAX Delivery Sharepoint site.
